books.author: Tara Westover
books.title: Educated
books.description: It is a tale of fierce family loyalty and of the grief that comes with severing the closest of ties. With...

books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.description: Holden Caulfield, a teenager from New York City, deals with issues of identity, belonging, loss, and connection after being expelled from prep school.

books.author: Agatha Christie
books.title: Murder on the Orient Express
books.description: Detective Hercule Poirot investigates a murder that occurs aboard the luxurious train known as the Orient Express.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: Winston Smith, a member of the ruling Party in London, faces a world of government surveillance and propaganda, where truth is manipulated and the past is rewritten.

books.author: Ray Bradbury
books.title: Fahrenheit 451
books.description: In a dystopian future, books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

books.author: Gillian Flynn
books.title: Gone Girl
books.description: On the morning of his fifth wedding anniversary, Nick Dunne's wife Amy suddenly disappears. As the investigation proceeds, Nick becomes the prime suspect in her disappearance.

books.author: Margaret Atwood
books.title: The Handmaid's Tale
books.description: In a dystopian future, a woman is forced to serve as a concubine under a fundamentalist theocratic dictatorship.

books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
books.description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, in which a young boy discovers he is a wizard and attends a magical school.

books.author: Stephenie Meyer
books.title: Twilight
books.description: A teenage girl falls in love with a vampire, leading to a dangerous and complicated relationship.

books.author: Harper Lee
books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.description: Set in the 1930s in the fictional town of Maycomb, Alabama, the novel explores the irrationality of adult attitudes towards race and class in the Deep South.

books.author: Donna Tart
books.title: The Secret History
books.description: A group of classics students at an elite New England college are drawn into a dark and dangerous world.

books.author: Michael Lewis
books.title: Moneyball: The Art of Winning an Unfair Game
books.description: The story of how the Oakland Athletics' baseball team used statistics to challenge conventional wisdom and build a winning team.

books.author: Anthony Doerr
books.title: All the Light We Cannot See
books.description: Set during World War II, the novel tells the story of a blind French girl and a German boy whose paths eventually cross.

books.author: Ken Follett
books.title: The Pillars of the Earth
books.description: A historical novel set in 12th century England, following the construction of a cathedral and the lives of the people involved.

books.author: Ernest Hemingway
books.title: The Old Man and the Sea
books.description: An elderly fisherman battles a giant marlin in the Gulf Stream off the coast of Cuba.

books.author: Gillian Flynn
books.title: Gone Girl
books.description: A thriller novel that follows the disappearance of a woman on her fifth wedding anniversary.

books.author: Mark Manson
books.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
books.description: A self-help book that encourages readers to focus on what really matters in life, and not waste time on trivial things.

books.author: John Steinbeck
books.title: Of Mice and Men
books.description: A novella set in California during the Great Depression, following two migrant workers who travel from place to place in search of work.
